Comment: I love to play d5 after d4, because I learnt this black opening defence, from FM Charles Galofre via a video on chess.com, He calls it a universal system,

After Playing d5 my next move is usually c6 or gKnight to f6 or cBishop to f5 what your trying to achieve with black is a triangle on the light squares, once the c Bishop is outside the pawn chain then shut the door with pawn to e6, making your triangle complete if your allowed to do so, I believe this opening defense for black is some sort of slav or semi slav, I have adapted it even further from learning it originally, by altering it after several times being attacked on b7 or a7, got a little fed up so I bought a video on slavs and called it a6
My next move is as normal c6
Here on move 2 I am building my triangle on the light squares, my 3rd move if allowed is puting my c bishop to f5 which is outside my pawn chain
ionescu played Nc3, so I will play Nf6, covering the square e4 and also d5 also developing my pieces
I have thought about the move and played my c bishop outside the pawn chain, my next move will be as I was going to move Nf6
My opponent just played 4. h3, I am not sure why for definite he played h3, I think he is trying to stop my bishop going onto g4, threatening the knight defender on f3
This my 4. h6 is to protect the bishop if attacked by the Knight on h4 from Nf3,I can hide the bishop, I call it a car park just put it here on h7 if attacked and is protected by Rook on h8
Here my opponent has attacked my bishop on f5 so I will park it in the car park on h7,
His knight has just moved to e5 an ideal square to course mayhem, but my move will be my b8 knight to d7 attacking his knight on e5,
His knight has just moved to e5 an ideal square to course mayhem, but my move will be my b8 knight to d7 attacking his knight on e5,
He then took my knight on d7 so I remove it with Queen to d7,
He then took my knight on d7 so I remove it with Queen to d7,
Here he plays Bishop to g2, I will castle long here giving me a rook behind my Queen on d8 giving me some power on the d file
Here he plays Bishop to g2, I will castle long here giving me a rook behind my Queen on d8 giving me some power on the d file

He now played 9. e4 attacking my pawn on d5, To back up my d5 pawn I can either close the door with pawn to e6 or My knight to f6 which also attacks e4 and also protects d5 remembering my bishop on h7 which is aiming at e4, so he has 3 attackers attacking my pawn on d5, but I will have 4 protecters so I will win that d5 argument.

He now played 9. e4 attacking my pawn on d5, To back up my d5 pawn I can either close the door with pawn to e6 or My knight to f6 which also attacks e4 and also protects d5 remembering my bishop on h7 which is aiming at e4, so he has 3 attackers attacking my pawn on d5, but I will have 4 protecters so I will win that d5 argument.

He walks on by d5 pawn to e5, my problem here is I have my Queen on d7, where I should have put my Knight on d7 but with the queen on d7, I dont want to develop my knight onto g8 or e8, So I am forced to move my knight onto e4, which is being attacked by his bishop on g2 and his knight on c3, I have only 2 protecting the knight, so more of an even argument.

He walks on by d5 pawn to e5, my problem here is I have my Queen on d7, where I should have put my Knight on d7 but with the queen on d7, I dont want to develop my knight onto g8 or e8, So I am forced to move my knight onto e4, which is being attacked by his bishop on g2 and his knight on c3, I have only 2 protecting the knight, so more of an even argument.
I move my knight to e4 awaiting his next move, will he attack it or not the ball is in his court.
He attacks my knight on e4 with his bishop on g2
I exchange his bishop with the bishop in the car park on h7, I don't know if he saw it, they can be a bit camouflaged in the corner, I have missed them before myself.
He removes my bishop on e4 I will look at this, and make my mind up what to do..!
I have decided to take the knight on e4, looking at the game at move 12. so far seems equal.
My opponent ionescu, has castled short or king side, opposite to me long side or queen side
